result.execSummary:
The defendant DESEAN A. MAHKIMETAS was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.

All financials same as noted above. 
Give DNA sample - completed.
All financials same as noted above.

11:18 AM Defendant DESEAN A. MAHKIMETAS in court, in custody.  Attorney Carly Jo Foor Ms. in court for DESEAN A. MAHKIMETAS.  Prosecuting attorney Gregory A. Parker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire received and reviewed covering 5 cases..  Victim rights have been complied with in the cases applicable.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to counts 1 & 2.  Off record.  Back on record @ 11:37 AM.  Court advises party of their rights, gives citizenship/deportation admonition, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty of counts 1 & 2.  Remaining counts are dismissed, but read-in.   Remarks by Atty. Parker and Atty. Foor regarding joint recommendation.  Court makes its findings and pronounces sentence.  Firearm and voting information for any felony convictions.  Appeal rights given.

SENTENCE:  
Count 1 - $100.00 fine + costs.
$200.00 DNA SC and give sample.
$46.17 restitution.

Count 2 - $100.00 fine + costs.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 31, 2022 at 11:15 am.

Court so orders.
